page.title: 02THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: Bassingham Telephone{Exchange. ------------------------------------- Bassingham Telephone Exchange is an important means of{Communication}for this area.The exchange covers an area of 58 square kilometres and serves 581 customers. The present{exchange}installed in 1955,is a unit{automatic}type 13 exchange.This replaced the previous type 12 and the earlier type 5. { Automatic}trunk dialling was first installed in March 1970.Thus linking this exchange with the main, nationwide system. There are 7{Public Payphones one in each of the surrounding villages. The life expectancy of this exchange is for a further 10 years. --------------------------------------
